nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: The iconic pond at APU's main campus. Usually serene, today you notice plastic bottles and wrappers near the edges.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: A student with a garbage bag is trying to clean up, but seems overwhelmed by the amount of trash.

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: Oh hey! You're from Prof Danny's class right? I'm doing a solo cleanup. Every Tuesday I come here. Sad seeing sampah end up in the water.

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: It's just me today, my friends had class. Want to help for a bit? I have extra gloves.

choices.text: Yeah, let's do this together. Four hands are better than two.
I can help for 15 minutes. Got tutorial soon.
Sorry, I don't want to get my hands dirty. Good luck though!

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: Yes! Terima kasih! You know, I started this alone 3 months ago. Now sometimes 5-6 people join. Small actions attract others.

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: 15 minutes is perfect! Even picking up 10 pieces of trash makes a difference. The turtles here will thank you.

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: Oh...okay. But you know, this trash affects all of us. The same water flows through our campus. Maybe next time?

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: Together, you collect two full bags of trash: plastic bottles, food wrappers, even a broken umbrella. The ground around the pond and the pond itself look noticeably cleaner.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: You watch Iman continue alone, methodically picking up trash. There's something admirable about his persistence.

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: You know what I've learned? Most people want to help, they just need someone to start first. Be the first, and others will follow.

choices.text: You're right. I want to be that person who starts things too.
Isn't it tiring doing this when most people don't care?

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: That's the spirit! Start small. Consistency matters more than scale. And hey, you already started today by joining me!

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: Honestly? Sometimes. But then I see the area getting cleaner, the turtles swimming happily...and I remember why I started. Impact, not applause.

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: You've participated in a student-led environmental cleanup. (SDG 6: Clean Water, SDG 14: Life Below Water, SDG 15: Life on Land)

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: Evening at the APU bus stop. The campus is quiet, everyone is heading home. You wait for the RapidKL bus, reflecting on everything that's happened.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: A junior student you recognize from the food bank. He's reading a book on sustainable development.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: A poster promoting public transport: 'Satu bas, 40 kereta kurang. Pilihan anda membentuk masa depan. (One bus, 40 cars less. Your choice shapes the future.)'

nodes.speaker: Anis
nodes.text: Senior! I heard you've been really active with sustainability stuff. I'm thinking of joining Pantri Siswa next sem. Any advice?

choices.text: Just start. Don't wait until you feel ready. You'll learn along the way.
Talk to Kak Sara at the food bank. She'll guide you. And bring friends.
Hmm, I'm not really the best person to ask. I just did it for the experience.

nodes.speaker: Anis
nodes.text: Wow, that's really inspiring! You're right, I keep waiting for the 'perfect time' but it never comes. I'll sign up tomorrow!

nodes.speaker: Anis
nodes.text: Thanks, senior! I'll find Kak Sara. And yeah, I'll drag my roommates along. Hopefully they won't complain too much, haha.

nodes.speaker: Anis
nodes.text: Oh...okay. I thought you were really passionate about it. Nevermind, I'll ask someone else.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: Sara and Chai Lam appear, also waiting for the bus. They look tired but satisfied after a long day.

nodes.speaker: Sara
nodes.text: Eh! There you are! Wah, one whole day of SDG adventures. Remember when you didn't even know what SDG was? Now look at you, cleaning ponds, packing food boxes!

nodes.speaker: Chai Lam
nodes.text: Betul tu! From 'aiya, extra work' to actually leading initiatives. Prof Riza and Danny would be proud. Character development sia!

nodes.speaker: Sara
nodes.text: Serious question though, looking back, what changed for you? Like, what's different now compared to the start of all of this?

choices.text: I realized I don't have to wait for someone else to start.
Honestly, I'm still figuring it out. But at least I'm trying now.
Hmm, not sure lah. It was interesting but I don't know if I'll continue.

nodes.speaker: Sara
nodes.text: THAT. That right there is growth. You went from 'not my problem' to 'I can be part of the solution.' I'm actually proud of you lah!

nodes.speaker: Sara
nodes.text: That's okay! The fact that you're trying means you're already ahead of most people. Progress, not perfection, right?

nodes.speaker: Chai Lam
nodes.text: Hmm, that's a bit sad to hear. But hey, maybe next time something will click? Don't close the door completely lah.

nodes.speaker: Sara
nodes.text: So, what's the plan next? Prof Danny mentioned the SDG Campus Challenge, teams compete to create the best sustainability project. We should join!

choices.text: Count me in.  Actually, I have some ideas already. Let's form a team!
I'll join if you lead lah. Still learning, but I want to be part of it.
Let me think about it first. The sem quite packed also.

nodes.speaker: Chai Lam
nodes.text: Wooo! That's what I'm talking about! Okay okay, I'll handle logistics, Sara does outreach, you lead the vision. Dream team confirmed!

nodes.speaker: Sara
nodes.text: Deal! We need people who show up consistently anyway. That's more valuable than having a fancy title.  Welcome to the team!

nodes.speaker: Sara
nodes.text: Okay, no pressure. But the offer is always open. You know where to find us, probably at the food bank or covered in compost somewhere!

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: The RapidKL bus pulls up. The sun is setting over the campus, casting a warm glow over everything.

nodes.speaker: Chai Lam
nodes.text: You know what? This semester started with us dragging you to learn about SDGs. Now you're the one inspiring juniors. Full circle, bro.

nodes.speaker: Sara
nodes.text: The SDGs aren't just goals on a poster. They're about choices we make every day. And you've been making good ones. Jom, bus dah sampai!

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: You board the bus with your friends, feeling different from the person who started this semester. The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step, or in this case, a single choice to care.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: Looking out the window as the campus fades into the distance, you realize: you don't need to change the whole world. You just need to change your corner of it. And that's exactly what you've started doing.

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: End of Chapter 4 & Game: Becoming a Changemaker. Your journey from awareness to action is complete. But the real journey, making sustainable choices every day, is just beginning.
